output.conclusion: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of hydraulics, equipping you with the knowledge and skills to analyze and design hydraulic systems effectively.
output.introduction: Welcome to Intermediate Hydraulics! This course builds upon fundamental fluid mechanics principles to explore the behavior of liquids in engineering applications. We will delve into topics such as pressure, flow, and energy within hydraulic systems, with a focus on practical applications and problem-solving.

chapters.description: Review of key fluid properties: density, viscosity, compressibility. Hydrostatic pressure distribution and measurement. Buoyancy and stability of floating bodies.
Different types of pressure gauges. Piezometers and manometers. Differential pressure measurement. Calibration and error analysis.
Types of control valves: directional, pressure, and flow control valves. Valve characteristics and selection criteria. Valve sizing and performance analysis.
Linear and rotary actuators. Cylinder design and selection. Motor characteristics and performance. Actuator control and positioning.
Major and minor losses in pipe systems. Friction factors and Moody diagram. Equivalent length method. System head curves.
Series and parallel pipe systems. Hardy-Cross method. Computer-aided pipe network analysis. Optimization of pipe network design.
Design considerations for hydraulic systems. Component selection and sizing. System layout and piping design. Safety and reliability considerations.
Common hydraulic system problems and their causes. Diagnostic techniques and tools. Preventive maintenance and repair procedures. Case studies of hydraulic system failures.
